greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest primorial number (A002110) which divides n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2309
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
maple: if P > N then break fi;
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[Divisible[n, Times @@ Prime@ Range@ k], k++]; Times @@ Prime@ Range[k - 1], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 30 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n), r = 1, k = 1, p); while(k<=matsize(f)[1], p=prime(k); if(f[k,1]!=p,return(r));r*=p; k++) ; r
a(n) = my(r = 1, p = 2); while(n/p==n\p, r*=p; p=nextprime(p+1));r
\\ list of all terms upto n#.
lista(n) = my(l = List([1]),k,s=1); forprime(i=2,n, for(j=1,i-1, for(k=1,s, listput(l,l[k]))); l[#l]*=i; s=#l); l \\ _David A. Corneth_, Aug 30 2016
(PARI) a(n)=my(s=1); forprime(p=2,, if(n%p, return(s), s *= p)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 07 2016
results.author: Frederick Magata (frederick.magata(AT)uni-muenster.de), Jan 19 2000
